[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: verify()] [State proof verification] When verifying state proofs with signatures, can an attacker exploit verify() to accept invalid proofs, allowing fake state reads? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Snapshot consistency] If signatures in to_bytes() format are included in state snapshots, can byte representation differences break snapshot verification across nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: Clone] [State cloning] When state is cloned for execution speculation, can signature cloning introduce shared references that cause mutation visibility across execution branches? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: PartialEq] [State comparison] If state equality depends on signature comparison via PartialEq, can byte-level differences that don't affect cryptographic validity cause false inequality? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: verify_arbitrary_msg()] [Computational DoS] Can an attacker craft signatures that maximize computation time in verify_arbitrary_msg() (particularly in verify_strict), causing validator slowdowns without adequate gas charges? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: check_s_malleability()] [Worst-case performance] Does check_s_malleability() have consistent performance for all inputs, or can attackers craft inputs that hit worst-case paths, causing gas estimation failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: verify()] [Gas metering accuracy] If verify() is called from Move, does gas metering accurately reflect the computational cost including both check_s_malleability() and verify_strict()? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: TryFrom] [Mempool flooding] Can attackers flood the mempool with transactions containing signatures that pass TryFrom but fail verify(), causing resource exhaustion without paying gas? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: check_s_lt_l()] [Branch prediction] Does check_s_lt_l() have predictable branching behavior that could be exploited for timing attacks to extract private keys through statistical analysis? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: verify_arbitrary_msg()] [Library version mismatch] If ed25519_dalek is upgraded, can version mismatches between validators cause signature verification divergence, leading to consensus forks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Constant: ED25519_SIGNATURE_LENGTH] [Length constant changes] If future protocol upgrades change ED25519_SIGNATURE_LENGTH, can this cause validation failures for historical signatures in state proofs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: check_s_malleability()] [Backwards compatibility] Are there any historical signatures in the chain that would fail check_s_malleability() if applied retroactively, and could this break state replay? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: ValidCryptoMaterial trait] [AIP-80 compatibility] If the AIP-80 prefix changes in future versions, can this break compatibility with existing wallets and cause signature verification failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: verify_strict()] [Dalek API changes] Does the code depend on specific ed25519_dalek API behavior that could change in future versions, potentially breaking strict verification semantics? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: verify_arbitrary_msg()] [Fault injection] Can an attacker use fault injection (e.g., rowhammer, voltage glitching) on validator hardware to bypass verify_strict checks, accepting invalid signatures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: check_s_malleability()] [Side-channel timing] Can precise timing measurements of check_s_malleability() leak information about the S component, enabling lattice attacks on private keys? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: verify_arbitrary_msg()] [Cache timing] Does verify_arbitrary_msg() have data-dependent memory access patterns that leak signature information through cache timing side-channels? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: check_s_lt_l()] [Power analysis] Can power consumption analysis during check_s_lt_l() execution reveal information about the S component, enabling key recovery? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: verify_arbitrary_msg()] [Nonce reuse detection] If signers accidentally reuse nonces, does verify_arbitrary_msg() have any mechanism to detect or prevent this, or can attackers extract private keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: verify()] [Quantum resistance] As quantum computers advance, can pre-computed quantum attacks break Ed25519 signatures verified by verify(), and is there any post-quantum fallback? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: check_s_malleability()] [Weak randomness] If the underlying RNG used for signature generation is weak, does check_s_malleability() provide any protection against predictable signatures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: verify_arbitrary_msg()] [Cofactor attacks] Does verify_strict properly handle cofactor-related attacks on the Edwards curve, or could specific point choices enable authentication bypasses? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [DER encoding issues] Although Ed25519 uses raw bytes, are there any contexts where to_bytes() output is DER-encoded, potentially introducing malleability? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: verify_arbitrary_msg()] [Twist attacks] Can an attacker exploit twist curve points in verify_arbitrary_msg() to create signatures that verify on the wrong curve, bypassing authentication? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/ed25519/ed25519_sigs.rs] [Function: verify()] [Multi-ed25519 confusion] Can signatures from single Ed25519 verification be confused with multi-ed25519 signatures in aggregate operations, causing threshold bypasses? (Critical)
